answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that personal information is collected through the app for various purposes, indicating that the app declares the collection of data.

Privacy Policy
Who We Are
Whilst your legal agreement may be with a different legal entity, depending on your residence, unless notified otherwise, Sphere Health Innovations Limited (‘we‘, ‘us‘ or ‘our‘) is the controller responsible for processing any personal data you submit to us via our website or mobile application. We are a private company limited by shares, registered in England and Wales (Registration No 12107479) with its registered office at c/o Work.Life, 13 Hawley Crescent, London, N...

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: Name, email address, date of birth, gender, answers to pre-formulated questions about health, device-specific information, screen resolution, device memory, OS type and version, IP address, IDFA or AAID, type of internet connection, approximate location, details of App use, App interaction information.

content: Answers to pre-formulated questions about health
Device-specific information (such as model, screen resolution, memory, OS type, IP address)
Approximate location, App use details, App interaction information

reply.analysis: The app collects a variety of data types including personal information like name, email, date of birth, gender, answers about health, and device-specific information.
reply.reference: Name and email address, Date of birth, gender, Answers to pre-formulated questions about your health, Device-specific information such as device model, screen resolution, device memory, OS type and version, IP address, IDFA or AAID, type of internet connection, approximate location, details of your use of the App and App interaction information. URL: https://www.mysphereapp.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that users have the right to request the deletion of their personal data or to opt out of data collection, providing a way for users to exercise control over their data.
reply.reference: You have the right to request the deletion of your personal data or to object to the processing of your personal data. URL: https://www.mysphereapp.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares data with third parties such as Google Firebase Cloud Storage and Google Analytics for Mobile Apps.
reply.reference: Third party Disclosure: Suppliers including but not limited to: Google Firebase Cloud Storage to store data and facilitate the provision of the Service. Google Analytics for Mobile Apps to facilitate the promotion and improvement of the Service. This is necessary for the performance of the contract between us (ie the App’s T&Cs) (Article 6(1)(b) GDPR). URL: https://www.mysphereapp.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with Suppliers such as Google Firebase Cloud Storage and Google Analytics for Mobile Apps, as well as Advisors including professional advisors like solicitors and accountants, and Authorities like court services or law enforcement agencies.

content: Authorities (court services, regulators, law enforcement agencies)

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly mentions the types of third parties the app shares data with, including Suppliers, Advisors, and Authorities.
reply.reference: Suppliers | Including but not limited to: Google Firebase Cloud Storage: to store data and facilitate the provision of the Service. Google Analytics for Mobile Apps: to facilitate the promotion and improvement of the Service. URL: https://www.mysphereapp.com/privacy-policy; Advisors | We may disclose your personal information to our professional advisors that are usually regulated by a competent authority (solicitors, accountants, etc.) where that proves necessary. URL: https://www.mysphereapp.com/privacy-policy; Authorities | We may disclose your personal information to the court service or regulators or law enforcement agencies in connection with proceedings or investigations where compelled to do so. URL: https://www.mysphereapp.com/privacy-policy.
